definition: to exceed/to go beyond/to transcend/to cross over/to jump over
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more

sentences.english: A gulf that seemed unbridgeable was created between husbands and wives at times.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫和妻子之间不时会出现似乎无法逾越的鸿沟。

sentences.english: Yes, all of us writers need to guard against extravagating.
sentences.chinese: 是的，所有作家都要警惕不要逾越了这个界线。

sentences.english: And his parents went every year to Jerusalem, at the solemn day of the pasch.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母每年逾越节往耶路撒冷去。

sentences.english: In the eighteenth year of the reign of Josiah was this passover kept.
sentences.chinese: 这逾越节是约西亚作王十八年守的。

sentences.english: They are to eat the lamb, together with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
sentences.chinese: 他们也要用无酵饼和苦菜与逾越节的羊羔同吃。

sentences.english: This Passover was celebrated in the eighteenth year of Josiah's reign.
sentences.chinese: 这逾越节是约西亚作王十八年守的。

sentences.english: But in the eighteenth year of King Josiah, this Passover was celebrated to the Lord in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 只有约西亚王十八年在耶路撒冷向耶和华守这逾越节。

sentences.english: To dig an uncross able river for the one who loves you.
sentences.chinese: 为爱你的人掘起一条无法逾越的鸿沟。

sentences.english: Let the children of Israel also keep the passover at his appointed season.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人应当在所定的日期守逾越节。

sentences.english: And in the fourteenth day of the first month is the passover of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 正月十四日是耶和华的逾越节。

sentences.english: For me , Japan is really a wall I can't overstep it.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说日本实在是难以逾越的一堵墙。

sentences.english: But they would not forget the sacrificial and paschal aspect of the Supper.
sentences.chinese: 但他们不会忘记的牺牲品，并逾越方面的晚饭。

sentences.english: Beyond language barriers, there exists an insurmountable artistic preference barrier.
sentences.chinese: 除了语言障碍，还有不可逾越的文化壁垒。

sentences.english: The circuit of the drive is the only way for the subject to transgress the pleasure principle.
sentences.chinese: 驱力的回圈是最好的方法，让主体逾越快乐原则。

sentences.english: He witnessed the impressive rites of the paschal service.
sentences.chinese: 他看到逾越节崇祀中一切动人心弦的仪式。

sentences.english: Those who publicly overstep the mark by their ostentation .
sentences.chinese: 那些到处卖弄公然逾越社交规范的人。

definition: (fig.) gulf/chasm/wide gap/(originally) the Hong Canal in Henan, which in ancient times formed the border between enemies Chu 楚 and Han 漢|汉
to disobey/to defy an edict/to violate/to go against/to run counter to
not overstepping the prescribed limits/to remain within bounds
to go against/to be contrary to/to violate
to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
dare not go one step beyond the prescribed limit
pinyin: bu4 gan3 yue4 Lei2 chi2 yi1 bu4

definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
